contextId.information: These words are used to show that there is a specific, chosen time and not just any time. AT: "for that exact time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: for that hour, that day, that month, and that year

contextId.information: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that God will, indeed, live among men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: The dwelling place of God is with human beings, and he will live with them

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. The second emphasizes the brilliance of Jerusalem by naming a specific jewel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: like a very precious jewel, like a stone of crystal-clear jasper
